channel.title: Xtalks - Executive Talks Podcasts
channel.copyright: #x2117; amp; #xA9; 2006 Honeycomb Worldwide Group of Companies
channel.itunes:subtitle: Xtalks brings industry thought leaders directly to executives around the world.
channel.itunes:author: Xtalks
channel.itunes:summary: Xtalks provides a forum for the world's top business leaders to present their hands-on insight on the issues affecting your business. By leveraging the best of today's Internet and telecom technology, Xtalks reinvents traditional information channels by delivering breaking business issues and analysis while adding high levels of interactivity with live web conferences and archived podcasts. Xtalks produces information for executives involved in Business Strategy, Energy, Finance, Investments, Government, Health, IT, Legal, Life Sciences, Manufacturing, Mining and Telecommunications.

item.title: Designing IS Strategies to Stay Ahead of Network Threats
item.itunes:author: Xtalks
item.itunes:subtitle: Led by Dan Lohrmann, CISO, State of Michigan, Dave Cullinane, CISO, eBay, Michael Yaffe, Director of Marketing, Core Security Technologies
item.itunes:summary: Learn about computer security breaches and their devastating consequences on an agency and its constituents. CSO’s, CIOs and chief executives alike are making cyber security a priority concern. Given the recent events, everyone understands the grave impact of security vulnerabilities and communication disruptions to the agency’s business if cyber vigilance is not exercised fully. Take away points include, demonstrating a return on investment in security strategic, cyber security project case studies - specifically looking at Internet Filtering, Penetration Testing, Anti-Spam Filtering, IT Security Awareness and Cyber Emergency Exercises - testing your defenses with a case study on Michigan's involvement in DHS's global exercise called Cyber Storm
item.itunes:keywords: Cyber security, IT security, enterprise protection against hackers, protecting enterprise systems from cyber attacks, cyber security conference, cyber security webinar, core security webinar, Dan Lohrmann, Michigan CISO, Dave Cullinane, Michael Yaffe, anti-spam filtering, IT security awareness

item.title: PCI Data Security Standards
item.itunes:author: Xtalks
item.itunes:subtitle: Led by Seana Pitt (American Express), Mark Lambert (Parasoft)
item.itunes:summary: Aligning PCI Data Security Standards with Pre-Existing Privacy and Security Mandates
item.itunes:keywords: PCI, Data Security, Standards, Privacy, Security, Mandates

item.title: E-Discovery: Preparing for Uncertainty...
item.itunes:author: Xtalks
item.itunes:subtitle: Led by Michael Heyrich (Citigroup, Inc), Peter Pepiton (CA)
item.itunes:summary: The new amendments to the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure (FRCP), effective December 1, 2006, focus on eDiscovery and the accessibility of electronically stored information. These changes require even more collaboration between in-house counsel, Chief Compliance Officers, IT, Records Managers and business managers.
item.itunes:keywords: e-discovery conference, e-discovery web conference, ediscovery conference, Federal rules of civil procedure, federal rules of civil procedure e-discovery, FCRP, FCRP e-discovery, FCRP e-discovery amendments

item.title: The Five Key Gaps in Enterprise Cyber Security
item.itunes:author: Xtalks
item.itunes:subtitle: Led by Tom Kellermann and Michael Yaffe(Core Security Technologies)
item.itunes:summary: For the past decade corporations around the world have been hemorrhaging data to online criminal syndicates. These organized hackers no longer attack for fun, but now exploit vulnerabilities for financial gain. While there is no silver bullet when it comes to preventing attacks, this webcast will discuss the 5 key gaps in cyber security that hackers are able to consistently and repeatedly exploit.
item.itunes:keywords: Enterprise Cyber Security, exploiting enterprise security, cyber security conference, cyber security webcast, enterprise cyber security webcast, core security technologies, Tom Kellermann, cyber intelligence, hackers

item.title: Ensuring IT Security in an Increasingly Mobile Workforce
item.itunes:author: Xtalks
item.itunes:subtitle: Joseph Hungate, (TIGTA),Jason Sloderbeck (Positive Networks), Tim Cranny (Senforce Technologies)
item.itunes:summary: Your workforce is anywhere but stationed at the office, is your system keeping pace with the increasing agility of your workforce? Telework. Home-based work. Global workforce. Office space is shrinking; while more and more connections are being made to ensure continuous productivity of the remote workforce. This trend is increasing, especially witH the government pushing the telework initiative to ensure business continuity in times of crises.
